channel.title: Commentary on The Guyana Brief
channel.description: Recent content in Commentary on The Guyana Brief

item.title: De Boys Seh: Development Bank Loans, Mash Prep, and Why Big People Love de Word 'Ambitious'
item.description: Speedeet and Wilar try to understand interest-free loans, wonder who is paying for Mash costumes, and discover that big people use de word ‘ambitious’ for everything.

item.title: De Boys Seh: Oil Talk, Border Soldiers, and Birthday Party Entry Fees
item.description: Speedeet and Wilar from Pike Street, Kitty try to understand oil contracts, wonder why soldiers watching de border, and complain about paying to attend birthday parties.

item.title: De Boys Seh: Hotels, Digital Records, and Why Adults Confusing
item.description: Speedeet and Wilar from Pike Street, Kitty break down fancy hotels, digital health records, and why de women cricket team is de real MVP.

item.title: Saturday's Guyana Brief: Toy Guns Guarding Your Groceries, Solar Power Rising, and Guyana Women Battle Jamaica Tonight!
item.description: Security guards caught with toy guns at supermarkets, US$8.14M solar farm lights up Charity, GBTI launches private banking for the rich, and Guyana Women seek redemption against Jamaica under the lights!

item.title: Uncle Ramesh: Solar Success, Security Solutions, and Stop Crying Over Cricket!
item.description: Uncle Ramesh responds to the Daily Brief’s negativity with FACTS about solar investment, the government’s swift response to security issues, and a reminder that our women cricketers are STILL defending champions!

item.title: Uncle Ramesh: De Report-A-Hole FACTS (With Receipts!)
item.description: Uncle Ramesh brings DATA, CHARTS, and REALITY to the pothole app debate. Comedy Crew about to get fact-checked!

item.title: De Boys Seh: Wha Speedeet & Wilar Talking About Dis Week
item.description: Speedeet and Wilar share dem thoughts on cricket, video games, school lunch, and why adults always saying ‘back in me days.’ Short takes from two 12-year-olds!
